body_html:
Shouldn't we fix this by changing the typedefs using #ifdefs on the currently broken architectures?

Also my understanding is that calling the registration macros with our typedefs should work (that is, tensorflow::int64 instead of int64_t). If that's not the case then I think we have a bug which should be fixed in the way proposed in the PR.

Also my understanding is that calling the registration macros with our typedefs should work (that is, tensorflow::int64 instead of int64_t). If that's not the case then I think we have a bug which should be fixed in the way proposed in the PR.
body:
Shouldn't we fix this by changing the typedefs using #ifdefs on the currently broken architectures?

Also my understanding is that calling the registration macros with our typedefs should work (that is, tensorflow::int64 instead of int64_t). If that's not the case then I think we have a bug which should be fixed in the way proposed in the PR.
